channel.title: Stupid compiling error

item.title: Stupid compiling error
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

No no…

See, the reason you keep getting errors when you fix another, is because it’s in issue further back in the client. Take a look for things above the messed up parts.

IE>

[code]
public void blabla(){
sendMessage(“blabla”);

public void blabla1(){
sendMessage(“blabla”);
}

public void blabla2(){
sendMessage(“blabla”);
}

public void blabla3(){
sendMessage(“blabla”);
}[/code]
Once blabla1 is taken out, blabla2 is the only thing seen. Basically, blabla1 = blabla2. blabla1 = error. In the end, blabla2 = error. So, fix what came before blabla (or the void you had issues with (same with ints booleans etc)), and it’ll fix everything else. Also take the /* and */ from what you tried to fix away.

Read full topic

~also 100 errors~

what would happen to my server if iput /*at the beggining and */ at the end?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 25, 2007, 08:13:16 PM[/size][hr]ugh everytime i fix the error, more random errors pop up!wtf!stuff i don’t even tough, i get errors on!making me mad that my server is messed up…

item.title: Stupid compiling error
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Try:

public void rules();

{ sendQuest("@bla@Rules", 8144); //Title
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@bla@Register at www.gamingbums.com", 8145);
sendQuest("@bla@Or I will IP ban you", 8146);
sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();
}
else if(command.startsWith(“rules”)){
readRules = true;
rules();
}

item.title: Stupid compiling error
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Replace it with:

public void rules(); { sendQuest("@bla@Rules", 8144); //Title clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("@bla@Register at www.gamingbums.com", 8145); sendQuest("@bla@Or I will IP ban you", 8146); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); } if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("rules")) { readRules = true; rules(); }
